intro: Strobilanthes unilateralis, commonly known as the one-sided makepeace, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, asymmetrical inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its unique floral structure, with one side of the inflorescence bearing flowers and the other side barren, is a distinctive botanical feature. It is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
